page.title: 09CLACTON LIFEBOAT
page.content: Some Sundays the crew of the Clacton Lifeboat have a practice run where they see how fast they can launch both the boats.The Skipper showed us around the Inshore boat and gave us information about it.It has one outboard on it which gives it a top speed of about 20 miles per hour.It has plenty of radio equipment on it, for if it runs into difficulty's at sea.It has been launched 370 times and has saved over 219 lives.Then we went on the Pier to see the larger Lifeboat being launched.It is whinched down a ramp into the sea.The main boat has 2 outboards and a top speed of 30 mph. The main boat is only used in an emergency like if a trawler sinks. In a real emergency they call in a Sea-king helecopter.The Inshore boat is used for things like if a Dingy floated out to sea.
